Job Title: Production Technician Associate - Night Shift

Location: Searcy, AR

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Solutions driven success.

XPO is a top ten global provider of transportation services, with a highly integrated network of people, technology and physical assets. At XPO, we look for employees who like a challenge and can communicate effectively in all situations. We want to leverage your skills and years of experience to drive positive results while ensuring a bright future for yourself and XPO. If you’re looking for a growth opportunity, join us at XPO.

Logistics done differently.

At XPO, we’re constantly looking for talented individuals at all levels, who can deliver the caliber of service our company requires. As a Production Technician Associate, you will perform assembly of trailer components and subassemblies. Performs quality inspections of components and subassemblies per work instructions. Use of common hand and power tools in the construction and production of trailers. Required to work with a variety of materials including steel, sheet metal, aluminum, solvents, oils and abrasives.

Pay, Benefits And More.

We are eager to attract the best, so we offer competitive compensation and a generous benefits package, including full health insurance (medical, dental and vision), 401(k), life insurance, disability and more.

What You’ll Do On a Typical Day

Identify and perform repetitive assembly of various trailer component parts using blueprints or work instructionsUse various measuring and inspection instrumentsUse various power and hand tools in a safe mannerRecommend measures to improve production methods, equipment performance and quality standardsOrganize parts and equipment to maximize efficiency within departmentPerform work in a safe mannerMaintain 5’s environmentConsistently maintain a professional demeanor and communicate in a respectful and collaborative mannerFollow direction and be flexible and adaptable to changing conditions and expectationsCollaborate and support other members of the companyMaintain punctual, regular, and reliable attendanceDemonstrate the company’s core values and comply with all company policies and proceduresPerform other duties as assigned by management

What You Need To Succeed At XPO

At a minimum, you’ll need:

The ability to work in a team environmentThe ability to read, understand, and follow job orders and work proceduresGood communication skillsA high degree of skill and assembling techniques

This Job Requires The Ability To

Follow safety rules and work in a safe mannerPerform work in a manufacturing environmentWork outside if necessaryPerform fine manipulations of parts with fingersSafely walk, reach (including above head), bend, climb, push, pull, twist, squat and kneel in strained and awkward positions for prolonged periods of timeMay occasionally have to lift up to 50 poundsVisual requirements for this position are close vision, depth perception and the ability to adjust focus

Be part of something big.

We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, disability, veteran or other protected status.

All applicants who receive a conditional offer of employment may be required to take and pass a pre-employment drug test.

The above statements are not an exhaustive list of all required responsibilities, duties and skills for this job classification.
